org.gearman

Interface GearmanClient

  • All Superinterfaces:
    GearmanService

    public interface GearmanClient
extends GearmanService
    The gearman client is used to submit jobs to the job server.
    Author:
    isaiah

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean addServer(GearmanServer server)
      Adds a GearmanServer to the service.

      • Methods inherited from interface org.gearman.GearmanService

    • Method Detail

      • getStatus

        GearmanJobStatus getStatus(byte[] jobHandle)
        Polls for the job status. This is a blocking operation. The current thread may block and wait for the operation to complete
        Parameters:
        jobHandle - The job handle of the of the job in question.
        Returns:
        The job status of the job in question.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If an I/O exception occurs while performing this operation

      • submitJob

        GearmanJobReturn submitJob(java.lang.String functionName,
                         byte[] data)
        Sends a job to a registered job server.
        Parameters:
        functionName - gearman function name
        data - gearman job data
        Returns:
        The job return used to poll result data
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the function name is null

      • submitJob

        <A> GearmanJoin<A> submitJob(java.lang.String functionName,
                           byte[] data,
                           A attachment,
                           GearmanJobEventCallback<A> callback)
        Sends a job to a registered job server.
        Parameters:
        functionName - gearman function name
        data - gearman job data
        attachment - An object used to identify this job from within the
        callback - An asynchronous callback object used to receive result data
        Returns:
        A joining object used to synchronize jobs
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the function name is null or the callback is null

      • addServer

        boolean addServer(GearmanServer server)
        Adds a GearmanServer to the service.

        Note: connections are not made to the server at this time. A connection is only established when needed
        Parameters:
        server - The gearman server to add
        Returns:
        true if the server was added to the service

      • getServerCount

        int getServerCount()
        Returns the number of servers managed by this service
        Returns:
        The number of servers managed by this service

      • removeAllServers

        void removeAllServers()
        Removes all servers from this service

      • removeServer

        boolean removeServer(GearmanServer server)
        Removes the given server from the list of available server to
        Parameters:
        server - The server to remove
        Returns:
        true if the service contained the given server and it was successfully removed. false if the service did not contain the given server

      • setClientID

        Parameters:

      • hasServer

        boolean hasServer(GearmanServer server)
        Tests if this client has the given server
        Parameters:
        server - The given server
        Returns:
        true if this client contains the given server

      • getServers

        java.util.Collection<GearmanServer> getServers()
        Returns the collection of servers this service is managing
        Returns:
        The collection of servers this service is managing

      • setLostConnectionPolicy

        void setLostConnectionPolicy(GearmanLostConnectionPolicy policy)
        Sets the GearmanLostConnectionPolicy. The lost connection policy describes what should be done in the event that the server unexpectedly disconnects
        Parameters:
        policy - The policy for handling unexpected disconnects
